 They are known as the books of the Bible, the Talmud, the Koran, and more. I think that you should look through at least one or two of them, considering your position. I'm something of a biblical scholar myself. If you actually read the aformentioned verses in context, and show some humility in your response, I'll be happy to teach you more about these many, many times altered ancient Hebrew/Greek/Aramaic writings. 
 
 Please remember, every word of the New Testament was composed a minimum forty years after the death of Jesus. Most of it, much longer than that - people don't trust information that suddenly pops up, decades after the events, these days. Except cult members. 
 
 I think the reason for this, is that people are generally much better educated than we were a couple thousand years ago. That's also why religious belief has been on the decline for centuries.
 
 Like philosopher Bertrand Russell, I can more easily imagine a God who rewards skeptical free-thinking over blind adherence to whatever religion is the norm within an individual's geographic location. If I were a creator, I would be ashamed of my creative skills if my project had little respect for their own logic-based deductive abilities, and instead just believed whatever they were told. I certainly wouldn't want unimaginative robot-like beings such as that to be said to be created in my image.
 
 Respectfully,
 Derek
